description:
Some of the best sandwiches in the city. I live across the street and see their produce getting delivered all the time; everything is super fresh and the sandos are huge.

Definitely recommend!
author: Reviewer H.

description:
Order delivery from this place because I was starving. Long story short, their eggs are a hideous grayish green color. Absolutely horrible. I could even eat it after seeing the color of the eggs. I notified grub hub, they called the restaurant and they refunded me my money for the sandwich but I still lost money on the delivery. 

Terrible.
author: Camille P.

description: What do you have to do to a scrambled egg to make it green inside? So gross. I don't know if it was cooked in a microwave or what but scrambled eggs should be yellow and fluffy. This place sent me the single most disgusting egg I have ever been given.
author: laura f.

description: I just found 4-5 fruit flies in my juice, and didn't notice until I drank half of it.  So gross!!
author: R. B.

description:
A friend of mine gave me some great advice I normally tend to follow which is ; always try the house special!! (At least once) 

So trusting my gut I went with the avalon the house special. Mmm mmm mm! Only $9.75 already includes avocado. Check it out! 

I also paired my lovely delicious monster sandwich with an English breakfast tea since well it's only 10 ish AM . The service was ridiculously fast and very friendly! Check this place out for a great Sammy and paired with a tea, smoothie, or coffee. 

They have about 6 tables and a bar style seating with a few extra seats.
author: Janessa H.

description:
Just placed an order online for pickup and literally walked down the hill to pick up the order and the restaurant was closing up. Online hours say it's open till 5pm and I made the order online at 3:50 and got there at 4:02.

Fix your hours and don't except orders if you can't follow through with the service.
author: Tru T.

description: Went on a whim and wasn't disappointed, a bit pricey but you get a lot of meat and a good balance of toppings and condiments. Go on an empty stomach.
author: Rosa H.

description:
Fresh brew was closed so we decided to give this place a shot. Desperate for a sausage, egg and cheese sandwich, the first disappointment was Estela's lack of it, only offering bacon and ham options. 

Ordered a bacon egg and cheese bagel (they only had wheat) and a ham egg and cheese croissant to go. Very promising upon first sight. Cut in half perfectly, and after separating each half we were astounded by probably the best cheese stretches we've seen in our lives, fresh out of a commercial. After that, it all went downhill. Upon taking a closer look at the eggs, we both noticed a bluish/black green tint with white blotches throughout. This completely ruined our appetites and after a few minutes of google searches and careful deliberation, decided to give up on the sandwiches entirely. We will not be returning. 

They add 10% to everything. 

The coffee was acceptable.
author: Daniel N.

description: Love this place but if you show up TWENTY minutes before closing they tell you they're not open. Change your hours if you're not actually going to stay open when you say you are, easy solution!
author: Natasha M.

description:
Pleasantly surprised! Yelp didn't fail me. Had the Avalon and I thought it was really tasty and fresh. Yes it does get up there in price if you add a smoothie but I wouldn't say that it's unusual for union square/SF. 

I do want to come back and try a variety of other sandwiches and smoothies at some point. Also ordering through yelp was very easy if you're limited in time for lunch I suggest ordering ahead. I ordered around 12:40pm & it was ready by the time I got there at 12:55. I decided to sit and enjoy as it was not crowded and there was plenty of seats available.
author: M E.

description:
Overpriced  
If your going to charge me 10 bucks for a sandwich it better be good. I had high expectations due to previous yelp reviews and the fact they claimed they use fresh ingredients. My sandwich was sadly mediocre. Nothing special. Could have paid $6 for the same sandwich down the street. 

Will say the smoothie was really good. Too bad it was 6 bucks tho
author: Enrique P.

description: Love their twanger smoothie. The smoothies are so fresh. Sandwich's are also delicious here. I am very glad to have this place around the corner. You cannot go wrong coming here.
author: A Nicole M.

description:
Yes. Just yes. I'm a sandwich lover and this place is wonderful!

I ordered the fresh herb albacore tuna sandwich. In addition to the great tasting tuna, the cheddar, onions, avocado and sprouts were nice together. It was $10, which is a bit pricey but seemed standard for the area. The sandwich was quite large though.

And the juice! I ordered a carrot, apple, beet, ginger, and lemon juice for less than $6! Fresh squeezed for that price? Amazing!

The service was quick and friendly and the place was quiet and quaint. I'll definitely be back.
author: Lee L.

description: I came here on friends recommendation. I had their special - Avalon sandwich. It was pretty good. Was it spectacular? - No. Hence four stars.
author: Ynu G.

description:
Cute little sandwich shop with sidewalk seating and open windows. A bit on the pricey side for simplistic (though wholesome) sandwiches, $9-$10, and they come without any sides. It's a very tiny space, so I can imagine a bustling crowd during the meal hours, and with little standing space and only 1 person behind the counter taking orders and making all the sandwiches/salads by hand, it can get cramped, noisy, and be a long wait if you're just looking to grab-and-go. 

Nonetheless, the ingredients are all very fresh, lean, and tasty. Sandwiches are thick with your main selection, along with a variety of fresh veggies. Staff person was friendly and accommodating. Overall, a pleasant find on Yelp.
author: Alison A.

description: I don't know if I've caught this place on bad days....two different bad days, or what, but I've had two disappointing experiences.  The major bad experience involved dealing with a very cranky and disgruntled employee, perhaps a manager.  It was early in the afternoon and the place was totally empty except for a few employees.  I was looking through the door unsure if I should enter because it might be too early when this older guy with longish hair yells over, "What are you staring at? Are you coming in?" Thinking his ridiculously inappropriate tone was sarcasm, I went in and ordered.  As I was giving him the order, he seemed annoyed to be there.  He was totally uninterested in what I was saying to the point where it was simply rude.  He took my money and barked the order at a teenage girl who made the sandwich.  As I waited, I saw him continually scold her as she made my food.  When my food was ready, the main literally threw the bag on the counter saying, "Here"!  The food is fair at best.  Meats tend to be on the slimy side which isn't great.  On top of the rude service, they're overpriced.  There are MANY other options nearby with friendly service, quality food and good prices.  Unless no other place is open for whatever reason, I'd stay away from this place.
author: Douglas F.

description: 5 stars because he quality is great and the service is great. But it was 18.95 for a sandwich and smoothie. For 20 bucks I could get a decent amount of sushi. Don't get me wrong, it was a big sandwich and smoothie but I'd rather have a smaller sandwich for a cheaper price. Definitely 5 stars tho! Just not cheap. But I think it's because their food isn't "cheap"
author: Maddy H.

description:
I'm giving this place a positive review, even though I can't honestly say that I enjoyed my sandwich. The problem was the bread. The sourdough roll made the sandwich so tall that I couldn't possibly have gotten my mouth around it. More importantly, it was so tough that with each bite it was an open question which would give out first, the bread or my teeth. In the end, I didn't want to push my luck, so I abandoned the bread altogether and just ate the insides. 

Still, I liked pretty much everything else about this place. The sandwich ingredients were fresh and well balanced, the ambiance and service were nice, the sandwich selection was diverse and interesting, and the smoothie was delicious. Oh, and there are several other bread choices! 

I'll definitely be back, not for a rematch with that particular bread, but to try another of their sandwiches on a different bread.

Give it a try. Just don't order the sourdough roll unless you have a very big mouth and very strong, sharp teeth!
author: Anton M.

description: The sandwich ingredients are always fresh, and tasty! Estela prides her business on Customer Service, and wholesome ingredients. This sandwich shop is still my favorite place to get a sandwich.
author: MacKenzie G.

description: Wheat grass helps reduce hair loss. Sounds crazy, but it is true. I have a shot of wheat grass every day at home, but when I travel, it is often difficult to find fresh wheat grass. San Francisco is no exception. After making my way over to a store that purported to have wheat grass, I was disappointed. I called just about every juice store listed in Yelp and none carried wheat grass! I was  on a mission and not about to give up. I called Estela's. I was pessimistic as the name says it's a sandwich shop, but I wanted to leave no stone unturned. Much to my surprise, the friendly voice on the other end of the phone said that they had fresh wheat grass shots. I walked up the steepest freakin'  hill I ever saw and down the other side. My 40 minute trek was rewarded with 2 oz of fresh wheat grass and a yummy apple, carrot, ginger, celery, cucumber juice.
author: Cynthia H.

description: Missed lunch at a meeting and set off on foot not having a clear yen except not to have to walk back up to many hills. Came across Estelas and odered a Greek salad and a beet, carrot, ginger smoothie. It seemed an unusually warm day, so sat outside, sharing a table, kindly offered by an attorney on lunch. I say that because the kindness of strangers should be remarked. And, well, it made for an even nicer experience. The salad was unusually good. I loved the fresh ingredients including avocado and feta. The citrus dressing was zingy and delicious. Zingy is a better word for the smoothy with ginger. Loved it. All foertified me to happily reclimb the hills.
author: Mary L.

description: The young girl working the counter was really food about making us GREAT sandwiches even though we showed up 20 mins before closing time.
author: Nichole H.

description: Disappointed in the service and quality of food. Took 30 minutes to get the sandwich and they didn't include the avocado I ordered and paid for. Don't waste your time and money when there is 4 other places on the same block
author: Amanda J.

description: Don't get my wrong, it's healthy juices & sandwiches but I wish the gentleman at the cashier / employees would wash hands or wear gloves before juicing a bunch of veggies and peeled fruits.
author: Daryüsch R.

description: Sandwiches are decent, when they get the order right. The two girls making the sandwiches looked like temps and seemed to have trouble making our order.  Of course our fear came true when we got our takeout back to our hotel room. One of the sandwiches was just wrong. But more upsetting was that when I called back they did not seem to care. No thanks. I care as much about taking care of the customers concern as the product itself. The proprietor should feel the same. No love here.
author: Sean B.

description:
This is a review of the bacon egg and cheese breakfast sandwich.

I came here on a Wednesday when Fresh Brew Coffee across the street was closed, and boy was it a disappointment.  At first glance, the sandwich looked promising: the croissant was more attractive than the competition across the street, though it was over-toasted and burnt in some parts - whatever, I was willing to forgive that mistake.  But the real problem was the eggs.... I have never had such disgusting eggs in my life!  They were scrambled and blue in several parts.  How does that even happen??!  I'm familiar with the bluish tint between the yolk and the white of a hard boiled egg, but it was the first time I'd ever seen it in scrambled eggs!  Moreover, the eggs were way overcooked and dry - amongst the worst I've ever had.  Additionally the bacon was not crispy.  Overall, at $5.50 (50 cents pricier than Fresh Brew Coffee), all the components of the breakfast sandwich were executed worse at Estela's.  I don't plan on returning.
author: Beatrice W.

description:
This place a legit good.

It's one thing those places you question the cost of the sandwich until that first bite.  

Delicious and fresh.
author: Dawn E.

description: The sandwiches here are really fresh and delicious. They're simple, not overdone like some others, and were filling. We pre-ordered through Yelp for pick-up which was really easy. Nice that it allowed us to pay once we got there. The service was mediocre as they weren't really friendly, kind of tossing my food at me, grabbing my money, and turning away to talk, but it was such a brief interaction so could have been a fluke.
author: Susan G.

description: came here since only 3 blocks from my hotel on Geary.  inexpensive & healthy breakfast.   ordered a blueberry smoothie and added protein and vitamins for only $7.74 total including tax.  Much better and healthier than the $12 breakfast meal plus beverage I had at a different cafe yesterday.
author: Stacy S.

description:
Just started working up the street and heard great things about this place. Love the menu and actually really liked the sandwich I got. 

Had a funny experience though. Ordered the Avalon which was described to have roast beef and turkey. Got it and saw a HUGE slab of turkey and literally could not see any Roast beef. The counter person helped dig out the thin slice of roast beef there. She asked me if I wanted more and I said sure. She took the sandwich back for about five minutes and it returned with MAYBE one more fine layer of roast beef, still very hard to see against the HUGE slab of Turkey. Seemed like the Roast beef was kind of a gimmick. Didn't really get what happened there. 

In any case, the sandwich really was delicious so what to do. Just wonder why Roast beef was included and why it took five minutes to add almost nothing to my sandwich. So yah, mixed experience. I'll try another one next time and imagine I will up this to four stars.
author: Matt S.

description: Not glamorous but great for a quick lunch! We came here after a run because it was down the street from our hotel and it hit the spot. The sandwiches are huge! We got the green green and the matrix and both were packed with ingredients and had sauces / dressings that really brought out their flavor. They have tons of options of sandwiches and a few salads. The smoothies were very good too. We got the mango and the BBB berry, which was very sweet. The bathroom was pretty dirty as were some of the tables bit fast service and serves its purpose.
author: Alyssa H.

description:
Estela has LARGE ass sandwiches. Half of it would make an okay meal on its own (unless you're starving). I thought the sandwich itself was overrated. I got the veggie one with the sun-dried tomato spread (sandwich #33, I believe?). 
Verdict: I like subway better. 
Estela's sandwich costed me $11, which is a lot. The subway sandwich is at least somewhat unique because of its sweet onion sauce. Estela has..... fresh ingredients, I guess? 
I'd only come back if I'm craving an avocado sandwich. But if you're looking for something unique, and more affordable, I'd go to subway.
author: Shalini P.

description:
Man, this place is tiny. They've got a great deal of healthier options at decent prices, but they aren't mind blowing and you'll wait a while for it. 

Probably the cheapest fresh juice you can find - $5 for green juice etc... compared to 9/10 bucks everywhere else.
author: Katherine J.

description: Have been to this place a couple times now and never disappointed. Food is fresh and tastes great!  Recommend you check it out if you're in the area.
author: Cathy H.

description:
It's 1:30, time is tight, and I'm starving.  I've been eating swill all week and I'm looking to get some produce in my life ASAP.  But I'm in San Francisco.  A salad sans sourdough will not suffice.

Naturally, I combined my love of avocado with my love of sourdough.  The Smoked Gouda, creamy avocado, lettuce, tomato, no red onions (please, I was in town for business), carrots, cucbumber, pea sprouts, mayo, & dijon on a sourdough baguette.

Tasty, fresh, and reasonably cheap.

Pro tip:  dudes (or ladies) with beards, watch out.  This thing is a mess.
author: Richie K.

description:
EDIT: Marking down to one star because the last sandwich I got to-go, the lettuce was completely unwashed. Huge clumps of dirt and could have easily had a bug in it. Not coming here again.

The Green Green (artichoke spread, dijon vinaigrette, avo, green veggies) is one of the best sandwiches I've ever had but this place is the SLOWEST place I've ever been. Even when it's not busy they work so slowly it's painful. Not the place to go if you're in a hurry. The help isn't as friendly as it used to be and when you walk in and they're making sandwiches no one might acknowledge you until they finished whatever they're doing, which is strange. They've often added things to my sandwich on accident, forgot to put something in, or totally forgot to make my order. But I just love the sandwich so much I keep going back :x
author: Diana C.

description:
SF needs more non-bougie health food places. That's where Estela's comes in.

When I went the two girls working there seemed like they were about 14 which was kind of weird. I got a wheat grass shot and a sandwich and they were both very good. Glad this place has a few locations, will definitely be coming back.
author: Nina D.

description:
I get it, the sandwiches are freshly made and  the place is cute; it also helps that this is one of the few places around the area where you can eat healthy and grab n go.

But let me be clear that the service here is SLOW. As a New Yorker, I expect things to be done super duper fast, but even throwing the New Yorker thing aside, Estela's took 30 minutes to make two smoothies. In that same span of time, they made 5 sandwiches and 1 juice.

I don't know about you, but definitely don't sign me up for OK smoothie if I have to wait 30 grueling minutes watching slowness at work.
author: Lee T.

description: Perfect little sandwich place. No frills, everything was fresh. They had 100 Food Safety score. If they had had a BLT on the menu I would have made it a 5.
author: Lisa C.

description: My husband and I finally tried this local sandwich shop. We had 2 of the sandwich specials and a bottle of water for a total of $22.71. I guess that's the norm for 2 pretty big sandwiches in our expensive city these days. We both had avocado on our sandwiches and were happy with the very generous amount that they give you. The sandwiches were really big, and after I got through half of mine I realized that we could have easily shared one sandwich. Well, maybe I'm just speaking for myself... Anyways, they give you a pickle spear with your sandwich, so that's a plus. I also liked that there were a lot of creative choices on their menu. If you're in the hood, and craving a sandwich, I would say this place would hit the spot.
author: Liz M.

description:
I initially really liked this place, because they had good fruit smoothies. But the slow service, subpar food and incomplete menu just ruined it for me. 

Today I went in at 11:30 am and ordered a smoothie and bagel. I was told they ran out of bagels. Ok, I get it, it's past breakfast so I understood. I proceeded to look at the menu and finally decided on their soup & sandwich combo. When I tried to order it, the lady worker told me she didn't make soup. What the heck? Why is it on the menu if it's not available. At least put a sign up notifying customers what's not available that day. 

The one positive thing is they seem to have fresh ingredients. The Greek sandwich I ordered had tons of fresh veggies, which I liked. But overall, it was just ok. The side salad that came with it was overly dressed and too acidic. 

I won't be going back to this place anytime soon.
author: Khristine A.

description:
I really love coming here, I frequent Estela's because its right near my job. Alot of coworkers come here for breakfast and lunch. I love the fresh ingredients and good selection. The juices are freshly squeezed and are very reasonable in price. I know that sometimes the service is slow, making it hard to come here all the time for my 30 minute lunches but because I've become a regular I know all the great girls that work in here I usually have no issue. You can always call ahead as well! 

All in all, I'd definitely recommend it here. (My boss comes everyday now)
author: Deja A.

description:
The food is so good! The bread
Choices are amazing. Cute little place to grab a quick lunch. We got the roast beef & loved
It
author: Dawn T.

description:
Found hairs in our sandwich!!!

This place has always been our number one choice for lunch sandwiches but this time we were super disappointed!

Owner, please take actions!
author: Roman B.

description: Great sandwiches! Little place but the sandwich was awesome. Knocked off a star only because it is 2 girls in there so if it's busy you will probably wait 30 minutes for your order BUT it was worth it. I had the Turkey Love and it had some many good, fresh ingredients on it! 100% recommend this if you are in the area.
author: Cambria S.

description: Stopped by here today for the first time and I will definitely be back.  The staff was friendly and the sandwich choices were pretty extensive.  I ended up going with #9 which was a turkey, BBQ and gouda sandwich.  I added some avocado and it was delicious.  Will definitely come back and try some of their other goodness.
author: Blake B.

description: This will be our go to sandwich spot whenever we stay in Union Square from now on, excellent food at a great price, highly recommend!
author: Chris J.

description:
Great service and great drinks. I came in for wifi, but was pleasantly surprised by their tasty smoothies and good service. I came in on a Saturday and a young girl served me a creamy blueberry and banana yogurt smoothie. She was super sweet and told me the wifi password before I even asked.

Would definitely visit again and try their sandwiches next time.
author: Stellar J.

description:
Breakfast cup.

Order was for here so expected my sugar free vanilla Americano to come in a glass mug. It did not. It was still smooth and delicious.

Instead my lowfat vanilla yogurt and granola came not in a bowl but in a glass mug. More room for my favorite combo. Only thing missing was a banana.

Worth the $7+ alone was using the free WiFi to get some work done at a table by a huge open window. Such a pleasant and serene city scene.

Enjoyable way to start the day.
author: Jason B.

description:
I live around the corner and have had their smoothies, juices, and sandwiches for a while now. I always stop in for a quick, healthy option - the proximity is the best draw for me.

Pros: 
Healthy food options
Fresh squeezed juices 
Usually not much of a line
Very customizable menu (can order off-menu)

Cons: 
I'm absolutely not a fan of the bread they use in their sandwiches. Good sandwiches need to start with a base of good bread, and theirs always tastes like it's lacking. 
Pricey
Very slow service
Not enough options for smoothies (I'm lactose intolerant, I wish I could sub in more options like soy/almond/hemp instead of yogurt)
There are always flies in the pastry display case (ew)

Also, I usually try to order avocado toast (off menu) and they always give me some sort of avocado sandwich (which is never quite what I want it to be) for an outrageous price. I still find myself coming back, but always not quite happy about it.
author: Claire S.

description:
This is my local sandwich spot of choice.

I'm very boring and always order the Turkey Love sandwich. When I feel adventurous, I order one of the smoothies. The ingredients are very fresh, the ladies who work here are friendly and the place is wonderfully sunny.

I had to take off one star for two reasons: the service is extremely slow and, almost as a rule, they are regularly missing ingredients (certain type of bread, meat, type of yogurt, etc.).
author: Liza K.

description:
Wow, talk about S L O W.

I was the only patron in the place and it took 15 mins to put together my single sandwich. I will say the delivered product was excellent but took way too long to prepare.
author: Robert M.

description:
This is my go-to spot for fresh squeezed juice and healthy delicious salads! I highly recommend this place for a quick nutritious lunch, especially after a long night.

$5.75 for a large juice, I get the 7C's and it tastes great. The really nice cashier recommended it when I had a cold. You can also build your own, with orange, carrot, apple, ginger, beet and fennel. 

I also get the Pear Salad that comes with goat cheese, walnuts, red onion, and honey mustard vinaigrette dressing. I skip the bread and add on bacon.

Overall, I'm a regular and this place doesn't disappoint. You can call ahead to place your order as it can take 15 mins if there's a long line.
author: J C.

description: I got the smoked turkey with avocado, and the ingredients and preparation were top-notch. The service was great. I was tempted to get something heavier, but my sandwich was very flavorful and most.
author: Rob F.

description:
Delicious. I grabbed the Italian sandwich, a large BBB berry smoothie. My girlfriend got the Greek sandwich. Both of our sandwiches were great. The ingredients all tasted fresh and delicious. The smoothie was awesome too. 

This place is definitely my favorite sandwich shop around here. We will definitely be going back!
author: Justin W.

description: Stopped here on a whim whilst searching for breakfast bagels in the neighborhood. Didn't end up getting a bagel- got the smoked Gouda, and it was awwweeeesome. The boyf got the war field, I think, with Turkey and he really liked it. Just asked him what it was called and he in fact wants one right now. This place is a lil pricey for a sandwich shop but maybe it's just cause I'm from Oakland. Minus a star because I got a carrot, beet, ginger juice and could hardly drink it cause it was SO spicy. And I usually like spicy! Oh well, I'd still go back.
author: Christine M.

description:
What an ideal little spot for your morning pick-me-ups! Coffees, smoothies, salads and sandwiches are all so delicious and the staff couldn't be nicer. 

Hangover Helper is delicious even if your not  hungover. There's also free wi-fi. All round this is a great spot and I'd come here every morning if I could!
author: Chloe C.

description:
I would like to review Estelas fresh Sandwiches for Catering.  
We host a regular codelab, and needed something delish/healthy. Estela and her staff personally helped us. She was kind and thoughtful. Another gentleman called to solidify the order and he was very insightful to their product.  Ultimately our 50 Sammie's were on time, within budget, and most importantly...they made 50 smiles on our participants. Thanks Estelas, we are big fans! #GTUGsf
author: Love U.

description: Sandwiches were big enough to sleep in. Fresh squeezed orange juice was delicious and well worth it!
author: Marisa G.

description:
The sandwiches are great, truly. I had a turkey sandwich with avocado, which was messy but very tasty. I would gladly order it again if I were ever going to go back.

Why am I not going back? Because I made the mistake of ordering a fresh juice as well, and let's just say today I am 3 lbs lighter. I know it was not the sandwich because my husband ate half of it and he suffered no ill symptoms. But hey, here's a positive - if you're looking for a juice cleanse, this place will fix you right up!
author: Monica H.

description:
There's nothing better than a late breakfast / early lunch than a sandwich and a smoothie!  It was a difficult decision, but I ended up getting the #21 which came with smoked turkey, sprouts, balsamic vinaigrette, tomato, red onion and cheese.  The sprouts were fresh; the turkey was sliced in front of me (yay for meat slicers!).  Their portions are huge!  I love that it comes with a pickle and peppercini.  I left feeling full and healthy.   I forgot to mention the best part.... the focaccia bread!  It was fluffy, flavorful, and went well with the balsamic vinaigrette.  I couldn't imagine choosing any other type of bread.  Go focaccia!!

I decided to be bold and make my own smoothie with strawberry, banana, raspberry, apple juice, and sorbet... it came out PERFECT.

Healthy, clean, and yummy
author: Candace C.

description: Everything I've tried here has been amazing! But ham and Brie warmed up ohhhh my, so good! I like the half sandwich/salad, it's a great deal. Try the pear salad!
author: Shayana W.

description:
The sandwiches taste so fresh! The pricing is usual for San Francisco. The deli meat is not too salty either, which is a common problem with many deli's. The location is good too and they have tables outside which is nice on a sunny day. 
Thanks Estella's!
author: Jannet H.

description:
TIP #1: Estela's makes a wide variety of big, fresh sandwiches. Perfect for lunch.

TIP #2: The menu is on the back wall, so you are facing away from the counter when you are reading it. This makes it a little difficult to order. 

The problem with sandwich shops that offer a ton of options--including a complex build-your-own system--is that the sandwiches are more likely to be mediocre. Fortunately, the sandwiches at Estela's are as advertised: fresh!

At lunch, the restaurant was bustling, but not too packed with people; my friend and I were able to order our sandwiches and find a place to sit within minutes of arriving. I was overwhelmed by the extensive menu! There are close to three dozen named sandwiches, at least 10 of which are vegetarian. The rest are packed with meat! You can add avocado to any sandwich for a fee. And if you somehow cannot find an appetizing combination, you can make your own--just try to choose between all the meats, cheeses, breads and spreads. It was dizzying in a good way. 

After you order, sit down, relax, and your food will be brought to you.

I had the Brie sandwich, not because I'm vegetarian, but because I love brie more than lunchmeat sometimes. Besides generous chunks of creamy, savory brie, the sandwich was balanced out with tomato, basil, onions, and sun-dried tomato pesto--all on the largest piece of the softest foccacia ever. That sandwich was so satisfying to eat--not surprising given THE freshness of the ingredients! The pickle and banana peppers that came with it were crisp and fresh as well. 

A great spot for a quick lunch! Looking forward to go back soon.
author: A.L. H.

description: Good breakfast and lunch spot. Everything's always very fresh. Mr. Espresso-brand coffee. I often come here with folks to catch up and chat; there's always a table and it's nice and bright.
author: David S.

description: Portions were large, but not much variety for salads. I did like the sprouts in the sandwich and salad though. Got the Avalon half sandwich / salad as well as the Greek salad.
author: Michelle X.

description: Love this place! Always very friendly faces and the sandwiches and smoothies are so delicious! My go to lunch spot during the week :)
author: Chauanh D.

description: Really fresh. Really good. Had the Smoke Out and Cow Palace.  The Mango Tango smoothie was excellent.
author: Michael S.

description: Delicious, fresh smoked gouda sandwich is huge and big enough for an entire meal. Stacked with cheese, avocado, lettuce, tomato and much else. Sat by the open window and let the sea air wash over me. Great little cafe for when you'd like a quick meal to eat in or take out.
author: Meg R.

description: I really love their veggie muffaletta! The juices are reasonable and the ladies working there are sweet. Sandwiches come a little slow but I think it's worth it because the ingredients are fresh - it has a pace that slows you down to enjoy the meal. My fav juice is the seven seas or something like that. Healthy sandwich pace just outside of the touristy bustle.
author: Chelsea K.

description: Great sandwiches! Huge portions of good sandwich combinations - good value for the money. Filled me and my family up for a long day of site seeing.
author: Jacquelibe B.

description:
Estela's is great for a few reasons:

1. It is located in a part of town that is ridden with tourist restaurants. The kind that say 5 stars, but when you show up you realize the ambiance is tourist hell and the food is at best subpar. Estela's offers a lovely reprieve from both the mediocre food and maddening tourist scene.

2. The juice bar is really the winner here in my opinion. Compared to some other fresh juice bars in the city the prices are insanely affordable! I'm talking under 5 bucks for a fresh squeezed LARGE juice. In SF that's unheard of. They make great concoctions, or you have the option to create your own.

3. The sandwiches are quite yummy. I wouldn't say that they can stand up to an Ike's or Atlas sandwich, but given Estela's huge wins in categories one and two I'm giving them 5 stars.
author: Meagan W.

description:
Edit on my earlier review.  There are new people working here and the quality has suffered a bit.  I got home to find my Turkey sandwich had no Turkey in it.  Not a great experience lately.

Consistency is the hardest thing for a restaurant but this place delivers.  I have been there about 10 times and it's great every time.  They have a wide selection of sandwiches.  They also make really good coffee.  The eating area is small and not especially interesting but they have a big bay window that opens on to the street.  This is a go-to place for me.
author: Rich K.

description:
We recently had Estela's cater lunch to our office, and I was really impressed. I think one of the best things about their sandwiches is the quality of the ingredients--everything tastes super fresh, and their bread really holds up (even a day later).

Their veggie muffaletta is great--it has a nice sun-dried tomato pesto and lots of shredded carrots to add some texture. The pear and goat cheese salad was also delicious with their lemon vinaigrette, which tasted house-made.
author: Rachel F.

description: Good quality sandwiches that are reasonably priced compared to other spots in the area. Also have some tasty smoothies.
author: Riley D.

description: Awesome fresh food served quickly.  Great atmosphere.  Had a great lunch here while visiting SF.  The Players Club was a great sandwich and the carrot orange juice was fresh and delicious.
author: Travis B.

description:
I love nothing more than a great sandwich, so it pains me to write this review. I used to go to the Haight Street location all the time but when I moved I discovered I didn't always want to schlep across town for a good sandwich. And Estela's used to have the best sandwiches in town. 

Fast Forward a few years: Estela's and I are close to one another again. I was so excited when I realized they had re-opened!! That excitement has turned bittersweet. 

They just can't seem to get it together at this location. They have screwed up EVERY order I have ever placed. Every order.  I want to stress that.

Like a glutton for punishment, I kept going back. But today I lost my patience: I said "no tomatoes, I'm allergic" and sandwich maker said "no tomato". We reviewed my simple order (the only change was the omission of tomato) three times and yet when I happened to glance over when she was making my sandwich and she was putting on tomatoes! I screeched unintentionally, the other customers jumped and I had to again clarify that I didn't want anything red on my sandwich. When I was handed my sandwich, I said "thank you, have a nice day" and got only a scowl in response. 

And now I am writing this review while I eat my very last Estela's sandwich. It was nice knowing you.
author: Hayesvalleygirl ..

description: The sandwiches were pretty delicious and packed with meat. The smoothies are amazing we got the BBB Berry and loved it. Even went back the next day to get another!
author: Jason A.

description: I am a sandwich snob - this place is SOLID. Lots of options, decent prices, good bread, nice staff, and they are always cleaning. Nice job ladies!! They also make juices and coffee - haven't tried those, but it is on my list. :)
author: Jessica R.

description: Great sandwiches with a smile.  Have never had a problem with the amoun of time it takes to get served.
author: Michael M.

description: I really dug this place. Pretty clean well lighted place for a sandwich.  I had a roast beef & swiss w/dijon on rye they called a "Cow Palace". Slightly obvious that owner could very well be a native. Prices are fairly normal for this part of town and it fit right into my downtown break time.
author: Sven S.

description:
I'm thrilled to have another relatively cheap sandwich option in the neighborhood! I tend to get the Player's Club with avocado (turkey, bacon, a few other things...but yeah, turkey and bacon), but there are a lot of options here for just about anyone. They have smoothies here too which I haven't tried yet but I will one of these days. 

I went to their Haight street location once or twice before the fire and remembered liking it, so I hope that if/when they do return there, that they'll keep this place open too.
author: Sus... B.

description:
Came here for lunch with some co-workers after seeing all the positive reviews here - definitely agree that this is one of the best sandwich shops in the area!  Pricing is decent (~$8.50 out the door including tax for sandwich).  

I got The Avalon per many mentions here.  That sandwich was fresh and very tasty.  Fresh ingredients make a big difference, and Estela's definitely uses fresh ingredients.  Seating was a bit sparse but we managed to snag the two tables outside for our group of 4.  

I've been trying to feel out the lunch options around this area, and I see that Estela's will definitely be on the regular rotation.
author: Leo C.

description: Excellent food, presented well, and the owner seems like a really nice guy! We will go back again on this trip.
author: Amy V.

description:
Worst. Service. Ever.

I've had a salad there before and it was pretty good but it's certainly not worth the wait. There were only six people in there when I ordered my salad but 30 minutes later they still hadn't even started on it. While I was waiting another patron, who had been waiting before I got there, asked about his order and when he found out they'd apparently lost it he got a refund and left. I eventually did the same.

The regulars seem to have it figured out: they call ahead 40 minutes. Must be a pretty amazing sandwich.
author: Richard W.

description: This place should be renamed "worlds slowest sandwich ever". The food might be good - I can't speak to that yet - but waiting 40 minutes to order and get your sandwiches when there are only 2 people in line in front of you isn't worth it!  If I hadn't already paid, I'd be long gone.
author: Rupa S.

description:
This place is right down the street from me. I love their sandwiches, but their juices are the best! Make your own combinations and see them juice it on the spot.

If you're a vegetarian, try the #26...brie on focaccia with sun dried tomato spread! YUM!
author: Jemma P.

description: Pumped to have this place nearby. The sandwiches are reasonably priced ($6.50 without avocado), and pretty tasty. I recommend the Avalon -- and definitely recommend asking them to toast the sandwich. The juices ($3.25 for a small) are awesome too. They have stuff like carrot juice, apple-orange, etc. It's all made by hand, and made to order.
author: Evan G.

description: Very cute place, friendly staff, and great fresh juices/smoothies. They also tend to close on the earlier side, but great for a daytime pick-me-up in the neighborhood.
author: Mel G.

description:
This place is a cute hidden gem in Nob Hill! I work in Union Square and I found myself tired of the same lunch places and usual lunch crowds. Estela's is worth the 10 minute walk from my office for well-priced sandwiches, salads and juices!

On my first visit I got a Greek Salad with Albacore Tuna on top. There was a generous  portion of avocado included in the salad and the lemon vinaigrette dressing was delicious. The salad also comes with two slices of French Bread. I also got a 7 Seas juice which was super yummy and left me feeling really refreshed.

The staff is quiet, friendly and happy to serve you. I 100% recommend this place for a nice lunch.
author: Amber D.

description: Not sure how good the food is because after waiting 45 min with an unusually well behaved 15 month old in a stroller, I was told (after asking) that my order was lost.  Poor managing of location left me and my toddler hungry and looking elsewhere.  Might be good food as long as you are willing to wait an hour or so.
author: Kirk W.

description: I am addicted to sandwiches...especially theirs.  Each sandwich is hand created and chock full of very fresh and yummy ingredients.  I've had about 25% of their menu and been with friends who have had another 25% and the resounding sentiment is that their food is damn good. The staff is friendly, but tend to rush a bit. These guys have a great selection of specialty sandwiches, ingredients and they pile their sandwiches high. I usually get 'the Italian'. So many good sandwiches that I can't pick a favorite!  Mix and match, it will be fantastic.  And wash it down with a wheatgrass shot or with one of their smoothies.
author: Oscar C.

description: Good sandwiches, but I had to substitute Parmesan cheese for provolone bc they ran out. If you're gonna get sourdough, you should make sure you order the sourdough roll as the slices seem like they were bought from the store. Their cranberry dijon mustard was good.
author: Kate H.

description: Delicious food and drinks, great for breakfast. The staff was friendly and enjoyable. This was a great treat to find while visiting from LA. Seating inside, pup friendly if you hold them while ordering. I will be back on my next visit.
author: Sarah H.

description: Best thing to order here are the selection of the juices. My favourite is the 'Liver Lover' juice: Carrots, Lemon, Celery and Beets  juiced to order - very refreshing. Coffee is good too. Croissant wasn't the best but it's not a bakery cafe so no expectation there.
author: Bomin K.

description:
Best sandwich shop I have been to. Probably of all time.

The Avalon is the shit.
author: Bill U.

description: yummy sandwiches, and the pear salad was fabulous. The lady didn't didn't wear gloves and she talked on the phone on the whole time.
author: S. c.

description: What a nice little find. Delicious sandwich. Half size was plenty and only $5. Great iced coffee. Two very nice employees working this afternoon. :)
author: Cee T.

description: Lunch here is really yummy!  I ordered a smoked turkey and smoked gouda sandwich with bbq sauce and avocado.  The sandwich was terrific!  The bread, veggies, meat and cheese were all super fresh and the service was great.  This is a small restaurant and not too many tables, but a great place to get to go. This is a great place to stop by and have some wonderful food or get take out.  this small restaurant cranks out wonderful food!
author: Bailey K.

description: Friendly service, great sandwiches, delicious juices. One of my favorite breakfast spots in the neighborhood. Love this gem!
author: Danielle L.

description: One of my favorite places in all of the area. The sandwiches are SO fresh and delicious. I also get the mango tango smoothie alllll the time. It is one of the best smoothies I've ever had. Also, the location is great and the staff is always so friendly. If you haven't been here, you MUST try it out. You won't be disappointed with their vast menu!
author: Caitlyn M.

description: Wonderful juice bar including fresh Ingredients: apples, carrots, beets, ginger, lemon , and fennel. First time there I ordered the seven seas which includes all of those ingredients. Delicious. However I paid for a large and they gave me a medium. Okay that's minor. Second time there I got one of the sandwiches which I hear so great reviews about.. I had to wait 20 minutes for a sandwich to go and when I got back to my office which I had to walk to I opened up the sandwich and realized it was nothing like I ordered. I literally paid nine dollars for a stale roll three pieces of turkey. I asked for "the works "except no tomatoes add pepperccinis  and the only thing my sandwich had was pepperccinis  This sandwich shop definitely needs to get a better system other than writing the order down on a sticky note.
author: Channing A.

description: The first thing we do when we travel is yelp organic juice bars and food.  Estela's was only a 5 minute walk from our hotel, the Hilton San Fran.  The sandwiches are awesome and the juices are just as awesome.  We have gone there every day since we got here and will until we leave.  Love this place!
author: Mitch R.

description: I started coming here for juices , but just had the greek salad from here and had to write a good review! :D Everything about it was so fresh and tasty! Definitely getting lunch here again!
author: Jamie R.

description:
Tasty food, but super-disorganized service.

As we waited for our order, one fellow brought back his sandwich because it was wrong. My credit card was charged the wrong amount, too little, and I made up the difference in cash to speed things along. Then they attempted to deliver a different wrong order to my table. Very odd, since the other reviews are so overwhelmingly positive. Maybe an off afternoon for them? Food was yummy, though, and that's the most important thing.

They get only three stars for cleanliness too: for example, the floors were stained with spills.
author: Evan E.

description: We were looking for lunch, so I got on yelp and checked out the reviews. This place made some amazing sandwiches. Had the turkey winterland... Huge and bloody delicious! Coffee was great and the smoothies were excellent! Love the BBB Berry!
author: Bek S.

description: I had to find a place with WiFi close to the Fairmont Hotel for an event that I was doing, and this little gem of a place popped on Yelp.  Estela's is great if you want a sandwich or salad and/or fresh squeezed juice.  They have a very extensive sandwich list which is not the case for salad, but the house salad with albacore I ordered was great!  The tune comes on the side and is not the heavy  mayo type of tuna salad you can get at some places which was an added plus for me (don't like mayo!)  I also got a fresh cucumber/fennel/celery/carrot juice for a healthy but filling lunch.  ANd the staff here is super nice!  Highly recommend!
author: Tanichka B.

description:
This is my new neighborhood joint. I go here everyday! Just ask Estella. They have the best juices at the BEST price! 16oz for 4.25 Amazing!
I get the Pear and Gorgonzola salad and custom roast turkey sandwich. I love it!
XX
J
author: Joshua M.

description: Simply as stated fresh sandwiches but done really well that you can only go wrong by intentionally picking things you don't like. The juice smoothie I got was great and the sandwich lasted my half day. They use good quality cheeses and ingredients and that made the perfect lunch.
author: Sumaia I.

description:
Decent food, avg prices, poor management. 
If you like waiting in line for avg food to pay avg prices this place is for you.
author: Noza C.

description: High quality food, tasty twists to old favorites, friendly staff, fair pricing=  HOME RUN!  Love this place and grab sandwiches and salads there at least once a week.  Keep up the good work!
author: Jory S.

description: The five fingers of life juice is amazing! I wish I lived closer so I could make this my regular juice bar. I have only tried the juices and definitely recommend them!
author: Rosie S.

description: I LOVE LOVE THEIR SANDWHICHES. So fresh and tasty. The bread is delicious. Great rapid service so I will definitely be coming back.
author: Elizabeth E.

description: best sandwich shop in the neighborhood and excellent juices, my favorite is the albacore tuna with avocado, check it out
author: N A.

description: My sandwich was all right, but it wasn't appreciably better than something I could get at subway or quiznos. Stay away from the juices - they aren't very good.
author: Ivan M.

description: Great sandwiches Veggie or not and a GREAT juicer/juice bar with some awesome concoctions!
author: Rob L.

description: I always go for the smoked turkey which seems like a deal at less than $8 since it includes avocado and is enough for 2 meals for me! Although it's delicious, this is not a complicated sandwich. Be prepared for a very basic cold sandwich. But if you're in the mood for a no-fuss lunch - check them out!
author: Emily S.

description:
If I had to rate the food alone, I'd give it five stars without any hesitation. The large variety of sandwiches are delicious and huge. Amazing vegetarian options, which is a rarity in Lower Nob. It's great if you want a lunch spot or to pick up an early dinner. 

Now, why I gave it three stars. It's clear that the owner and people who work there do not want to be at this location. I get it -- it's painful to lose a home where you felt part of the community and contributed to its spirit. But don't take it out on Lower Nob residents with attitude simply because we aren't Lower Haight/Hayes Valley.

This is a different neighborhood with its own rhythm and patterns -- that means, yes, you should have a stronger breakfast offering that you can serve to people *quickly* in the morning because we are on foot and en route. It means you should learn to make a decent latte (have yet one there made well or above tepid). It means you should take a little time to understand the reasons people live in this neighborhood and adapt. You don't have to fundamentally change your offering to do that and if you did meet us just a little bit, we'd repay you with our business.
author: Cherie D.

description: Yay! Estela's opened store #2! I love Estela's sandwiches, really so fresh. My favorite is the Avalon fka the big sherm.  Second favorite is the carrot.  These are delicious fresh sandwiches, not all meat calorie bombs on Dutch crunch rolls.
author: Wakako U.

description:
Slow, tasteless, expensive, and careless.

They have a lot of items on the menu, including several veggie options. They're priced $7.50-8.50. The sandwiches are big and the ingredients seemed fresh yet disappointing. There was only one other person in line and two other customers in the shop already had their food yet it took 15 minutes to get my sandwich. It was a cold sandwich and the bread was not toasted so I have no idea what took so long. And my request for no onions was ignored.
author: keith s.

description: This place is beyond fresh and the people working are so kind. I love to get their half sand/salad combo, which is surprising large. Great prices too, excited to try a smoothie!
author: Donna H.

description: Great sandwiches, inexpensive fresh juices, fast, delicious, great service.  I love the women that work there, they are all extremely nice.
author: Paul H.

description:
THIS PLACE IS AMAZING!! (and cheap!!)
I recently stumbled into this spot and was blown away by the variety their menu has to offer. They have so many options for vegetarians that I seriously had to restrain myself from screaming with joy. I recommend trying The Green-Green. One of the best, vegetarian sandwiches I have had in a very long time. I inhaled that sucker like there was no tomorrow.
And if you are a meat eater, there are a ton of options for you tool! This is a perfect place for my carnivorous boyfriend and my herbivore self to engage. Heavily.
Not to mention their delicious smoothies!! They are a great way to recover from a hard night out, or just a wonderful, refreshing, way to wake up. The BBB is perfect. I'm dreaming about it right now...maybe I'll just go get one before I finish this post.. 
I am so happy that this place is right down the street from my house cause I plan on going there as frequently as possible.
GO HERE! You will not be disappointed.
author: Danae L.

description: Pretty good sandwiches, decent prices.  Quick and friendly service.  The sandwich didn't have the 'zomg amazing' factor to be 5 star worthy though
author: Yan L.

description: Good sandwiches. REALLY slow service. It took them 10 minutes to put avocado on two sandwiches we got. I appreciate that they're being careful (?) but if recommend calling ahead or you'll miss your entire lunch.
author: Jamie P.

description: Everything is always so fresh, great portions, free wifi, friendly staff, and quick service. I love the Greek salad but the sandwiches are also great
author: Jon V.

description: Tasty, fresh sandwiches. Good veggie options (i.e sundried-tomato pesto, pea sprouts, shredded carrots) and solid meat options too.  The staff are friendly which is always refreshing. Definitely a satisfying, healthy, lunch option!
author: Lydia R.

description: I live on Bush St. so i have walked by Estela's a bunch since moving in, but finally stopped in and fell in love!  I am a vegetarian, and they had at least 8 veggie sandwiches.  My boyfriend and I split two, starting with the Sun Dried Tomato Pesto and the Lil Caesar sandwiches.  The Sun Dried Tomato came on a baguette, and surprisingly the balsamic dressing it had slightly overpowered the sun dried tomato, but it made it so delicious.  Fresh with veggies and smoked gouda cheese, it was so good!  The Lil Caesar was very true to a caesar salad as well, with a layer of shredded cheese on the bottom, romaine, tomato and caesar dressing.  It was on a focaccia roll, and if you are a caesar salad lover it will hit the spot, although we found it a bit rich.  The staff is very friendly and it didn't take long at all to make.  I am excited to go back and try the other sandwiches!
author: Megan H.

description: Quick service, good sandwiches. They put a yummy vinaigrette on there - be careful, it can get messy!
author: Jenny Z.

description:
Our office purchases sandwiches from Estelas at least twice a week. The selection is great, the sandwiches are fresh, nicely dressed up, never overdone with meat, and can always have avocado.

Fresh juice is cheap as well. What more could you ask for? Our office votes with their stomachs each day for lunch and Estelas is clear front-runner.
author: Michael Z.

description:
so pumped to have a fresh juicery in nob hill on my way to work! and they're HALF the price of where I usually go (larges are $4), plus they'll let you pick your own blend. score!
smoothies are amazing, sandwiches look good too. (havent tried one....yet)
definitely will be frequenting this spot now that i've found it. thank you estela's for moving to nob hill!
author: Amy F.

description: I love this place! Its run by the nicest people. The food is great and the juice delicious. Reasonably priced too.
author: Hunter S.

description: Super fresh vegetarian sandwiche on fresh whole wheat bread.  hangover smoothie is doing the trick too.
author: John B.

description: Now one of my go-tos when I'm visiting SF. Their veggie sandwiches rock! Everything is fresh and so filling. I usually have to shove in the last few bites because I'm so full but I don't want to waste any of it! My meat eating friends are just as pleased but I'm addicted to the vegetarian options!
author: S F.

description: Sooooo good. The East Coast/ West Coast beef was off the hook!!!!
author: Hmmmmmm N.

description: I never write yelp review's- but the sandwiches and fresh juices at this mom and pop shop are amazing!  And very affordable.  They also have a huge selection of vegetarian sandwiches which is hard to find.  Go there.
author: Seth A.

description: amazing sandwiches.  not your average sandwich menu.  not one ingredient over powers another.  Portions are just right for the price.
author: Joo P.

description: This sandwich place is seriously the best in SF. They have a huge sandwich menu, some awesome salads, and a plethora of vegetable and fruit juices/smoothies they make fresh. Nothing comes close if you're looking for a sandwich. They're also pretty healthy and all of their ingredients are very, very fresh (replenished daily). You will not regret eating here.
author: Zain A.
